description: Number of orbits of length n under the map whose periodic points are counted by A000670.
links: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..200
Yash Puri and Thomas Ward, A dynamical property unique to the Lucas sequence, Fibonacci Quarterly, Volume 39, Number 5 (November 2001), pp. 398-402.
Y. Puri and T. Ward, Arithmetic and growth of periodic orbits, J. Integer Seqs., Vol. 4 (2001), #01.2.1.
formula: a(n) = (1/n)* Sum_{d|n} mu(d)*A000670(1+ n/d), where mu is A008683, the Moebius function. - Edited by _Michel Marcus_, Mar 30 2016
example: a(5)=108 since the 6th term of A000670 is 541 and the 2nd term is 1, so there must be (541-1)/5 = 108 orbits of length 5.
mathematica: a[n_] := DivisorSum[n, MoebiusMu[#] HurwitzLerchPhi[1/2, -n/#, 0]/2 &] / n; a[0] = 1; Table[a[n], {n, 0, 30}] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Mar 30 2016 *)
author: Thomas Ward (t.ward(AT)uea.ac.uk), Mar 21 2001
extensions: More terms from _Alois P. Heinz_, Jan 23 2015
